p: The Paris Agreement set a limit on the global mean surface air temperature (SAT) change of 2.0 °C and an aspirational limit of 1.5 °C relative to preindustrial levels [ 12, 13]. To achieve this goal, countries submitted national mitigation plans in the form of Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDC). As of May 2019, a total of 192 countries have reported their respective INDC mitigation targets to the United Nations, accounting for the current mitigation commitments negotiated by governments [ 14].
